result.execSummary:
The defendant John Matthew Kratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Consecutive to: (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), with credit for 97 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 
No firearms; weapons.

No contact with victim, Erica K. or Jeanette W., without approval of the court.    
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
**02-23-17- Court vacated the NO CONTACT ORDERS with Erika K. and Jeanette W.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and ANGER Management and continue programming.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing JUNE 11, 2015 received and filed. (37 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to THE INSTITUTION

Defendant John Matthew Kratz in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant John Matthew Kratz in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Erica K. 

AS TO COUNT #1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), with credit for 97 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.    

AS TO COUNT #2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.    

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is/is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and ANGER Management 
   and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Erica K. or Jeanette W., 
   without approval of the court.    
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the 
  Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.   mld

Defendant John Matthew Kratz in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant John Matthew Kratz in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Enhancer; Use of a Dangerous Weapon on both COUNTS #1 and #2.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #1 and #2 (with repeater), defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.
 Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-11-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Court ordered defendant remanded pending sentencing.   mld
Final pre-trial scheduled for 05-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant John Matthew Kratz not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for final pre-trial.  Case adjourned for final pre-trial in Branch 4.  
Clerk:  jms

Defendant John Matthew Kratz in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant John Matthew Kratz in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty as to count #3 on behalf of defendant.  Photo cd was turned over to defense counsel by the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-23-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

Defendant John Matthew Kratz not in court, defendant in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Clerk contacted defense counsel via telephonics, and due to a calendaring error, the Arraignment Hearing is rescheduled to Branch 4 on 4-1-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant John Matthew Kratz in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant John Matthew Kratz in custody.  
Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Katie Seelow (under the student practice rule).  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State verbally amends the criminal complaint to strike the top paragraph on page 4 of page 4.   Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-31-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Erica K, Ava K or Jeanette W., are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Erica K; Ava K; Jeanette W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Matthew Kratz in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  
Defendant John Matthew Kratz in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to all MIsdemeanor Counts. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
